channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Japanese company vows U.S. Steel would be American-run as election-year takeover faces mounting opposition
item.description: The pledge by Nippon Steel, Japan’s largest steelmaker, comes after Vice President Kamala Harris said the U.S. company “should remain American-owned.”

item.title: Asian tech stocks slammed following Nvidia-led Wall Street tumble
Alibaba to allow payment through Tencent's WeChat Pay for the first time on e-commerce apps
item.description: Alibaba's shopping platforms Taobao and Tmall will accept Tencent's WeChat Pay likely within this month, a source familiar with the matter told CNBC.

item.title: September is typically the worst month for stocks. What investors need to know.
Wednesday's analyst calls: Super Micro Computer gets a downgrade, aluminum products stock to pop 20%
item.description: An artificial intelligence play and an aluminum products maker were among the stocks being talked about Wednesday.

item.title: That ‘Chase Bank glitch’ could lead to negative balances — and jail time
After Putin dodges arrest in Mongolia, the Kremlin says no one can hold Russia back
item.description: There was more than a whiff of self-satisfaction from the Kremlin on Wednesday, after Russian President Vladimir Putin wasn't arrested on his trip to ...

item.title: These semiconductor ETFs just had their worst daily performances in 4 years
Cathay Pacific confirms it expects A350s back in service within days after engine issue
item.description: The Hong Kong airline said 15 of the 48 Airbus A350s in its fleet were found to have engine fuel lines that required replacement.

item.title: Why did stocks slide? Factory data reminded investors that bad news is bad news.
